Art. 4.107. 
Maintenance of undivided ownership
If the heirs in the direct line of the premature spouse include one or more minors, the joint ownership of the property subject to a usufruct in favour of the surviving spouse may, either at the request of one of the persons concerned or ex officio, be maintained by the family court for a term or successive terms which shall not extend beyond the majority of the youngest minor.
This provision ceases to have effect, either in the event of extinction of the usufruct, or in the event of repossession of the property pursuant to Article 4.108.
The decision by which the Family Court maintains the joint ownership is entered in the register of the relevant office of the General Administration of Property Documentation.
 If the decision is not transcribed, it cannot be relied upon against bona fide third parties who have a competing right to the property.
